entityId.localType: State Records of South Australia Series ID

biogHist.abstract: This series consists of a volume used by the Adelaide Maternity Home to record information about unmarried women seeking to enter the home for the birth of their child.
biogHist.p: Although some early records relating to children in care in South Australia are open access, many later records are subject to restrictions, particularly records which contain personal information about individuals. Written permission must be obtained from the government agency which created the record in order to access restricted material. In the case of records relating to children, the current agency responsible is the Department for Communities and Social Inclusion (DCSI).
A Research Centre Members card, obtainable at the Archives, is required to research records held at State Records.

This volume contains pre-printed pages titled 'Private and Confidential Information' and details recorded include date, from, name, age, name and address of living relatives, place of birth, details of any previous admission to prison or other social homes, and name and address of father of child. Not all information is recorded for each entry. Some entries include remarks under the heading 'Further Particulars' which may include date of admission to the Maternity Home, date of baby's birth and notes regarding the woman's situation after leaving the home.

The entries contain similar information to GRS 13689, but this volume appears to have been used to record personal information about women seeking entry prior to their admission to the Adelaide Maternity Home.

There is a gap in the volume for the period July 1894 to May 1898. See GRS 13689 for this period. From 1898, entries include a consecutive register number that corresponds to the number allocated in GRS 13689.
The front of the volume contains an alphabetical index by name.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Records of McBride Maternity Hospital, formerly Adelaide Maternity Home (1893 - 1982)
